thread.title: TransAsia pilot pulled wrong throttle, says report
thread.title_full: TransAsia pilot pulled wrong throttle, says report

title: TransAsia pilot pulled wrong throttle, says report
text:
The captain of the doomed TransAsia flight 235 switched off the only working engine seconds before the jet crashed into a river in Taipei, a report has revealed. A still from a video showing the incident. Credit: @Missxoxo168 
The investigation by Taiwan’s Aviation Safety Council (ASC) did not assign blame for the incident. 
Forty three people died when the plane landed upside down in a river in February this year with 15 of the 58 on board surviving. 
In a cockpit voice recording Captain Liao Jian-zong was heard saying: “Wow, pulled back the wrong side throttle.” 
According to the ASC report, Liao had failed simulator training in 2014 partly because he did not know how to deal with an engine flame out on take off. 
Data from the flight showed that the plane stalled and crashed soon after the working engine was switched off, the BBC reported. 
The ASC will issue a final draft in November before a final report next April.
